messages.title: Vote Green in 2015
messages.content: The Scottish Green Party stands for an economy for the people and a society for all. Our party has grown five-fold over the last year and along with our sister parties across the UK, Greens are in a strong position to deliver a real alternative to the tired old politics of Westminster.

messages.title: What's important?
messages.content:
EQUALITY NOT POVERTY – We'll raise the minimum wage to £10 an hour by 2020
PUBLIC SERVICES IN PUBLIC HANDS - We'll run the railways as a public service and protect other services like the NHS from privatisation
POWER TO COMMUNITIES - We'll press for more powers for Scotland and for local communities

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We'll raise the minimum wage to £10 an hour by 2020.
We'll run the railways as a public service and protect other services like the NHS from privatisation.
We'll press for more powers for Scotland and for local communities.

issues.economy: The Scottish Green Party stands for an economy for the people.
issues.governance: The Scottish Green Party stands for... a society for all.
issues.health: We'll protect... the NHS from privatisation.
issues.socialWelfare: We'll raise the minimum wage to £10 an hour by 2020.

leaflet.personalStatement: If elected Richard will stand up against welfare cuts, and tackle in-work poverty. Be a voice for Edinburgh South West at Westminster, building upon local Green successes on the Council and at Holyrood. Support local business in the face of supermarket saturation, supporting community initiatives for a sustainable economy.

politicalExperience.role: Member of the Scottish Green Party
politicalExperience.achievements: Became editor of Greenprint (the party's magazine), moved to Edinburgh in 2013 to work for the MSPs, Ms. Harvie and Ms. Holyrood.

contactInformation.address: St. Margaret's House, 151 London Rd, Edinburgh EH7 6AE

images.caption: Richard Doherty - Scottish Green Party Candidate

leaflet.additionalNotes: Promoted by Robert Ince on behalf of the Scottish Green Party. Hosted by Richard Doherty.
